column4: hi  I'm trying to fix suspend/hibernate on one of our laptops, which has to run Intrepid for graphics to work.
sry
Asus X51L
What I need to know is where I should put my fixes nowadays -- up to hardy I'd have edited scripts in /etc/acpi, but I've read that the acpi-support is deprecated now.
So where do I put my pre- and post- suspend scripts?
not quite sure - google may be a help, but what graphics driver are u running?
Intel
google wasn't too helpful when I tried the other day.
sry. what graphics driver are u running?
Where do I find out what driver is being used?  xorg.conf is as good as non-existent
Anyway the suspend/hibernate issue is with the wireless card.
are there any bugs in launchpad associated with the problem?
There wasn't last time I checked (Friday).  I'll have another look...
Should I search specifically for the laptop, for the wireless driver or for the wireless card model?
just enter suspend and the wireless card, then try the driver
Thanks.
nickbooder: found something?
found something?
Something similar (#272169), but in my case the machine does come back, but wifi simply doesn't connect.  Attempting to connect wireless then messes up the next shutdown or suspend attempt.
Does /usr/lib/pm-utils/sleep.d look like the right place?  Mentioned in another mildly-related bug report.
that's a directory of various network related files
Looks like it'll do what I want.  Thanks for your search term suggestions -- they made all the difference.
Thanks for your guidance, problem solved.
